ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime

editorialNotes.standard: Moving’s a drag! Relocate to this satisfying puzzler in which you unpack boxes filled with all sorts of goodies.

name: A Little to the Left: Drawers

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice
A Little to the Left: Stars

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Willy's Wonderland
artistName: QUByte Games Desenvolvimento de Jogos LTDA

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.
With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.

This clever physics-based puzzle game challenges you to spray water to extinguish fires and manipulate the environment. Its simple, clearly defined mechanics allow for intuitive, satisfying puzzle-solving. New elements are routinely layered in, ensuring that the challenges stay interesting. Great visuals and impressive sound also set Sprinkle Islands apart.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: With relaxed swapping rules and charming graphics, this surprisingly slick match-3 puzzler makes the genre feel fresh again.

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

editorialNotes.standard: Use curious elevators to cross beautiful buildings in a puzzler that’s as stylish as it is confounding.

With Free App of the Week, we highlight a great app you can enjoy at no charge this week. (In-App Purchases sold separately.) ZeptoLab’s highly anticipated sequel is an absolute blast, filled with endless charm and brilliantly designed physics-based puzzles. Use all-new allies and abilities to feed the adorable Om Nom candy while navigating each stage’s unique layout and collecting stars along the way. With new mechanics smartly layered onto the series’ already famous gameplay, Cut the Rope 2 is continually challenging and engaging.

Railbound’s tough puzzles are brilliantly focused. You’re given only a handful of rail tiles to guide train cars to the correct destinations in the correct order, and yet even with limited options the potential solutions feel limitless. Do you lay track so Car 4 goes through a tunnel and waits at a crossing gate for Cars 2 and 3 to pass? Do you create loops to delay Car 2? Do you ignore the crossing gate altogether? Few games make success feel like it’s always just within reach, even when it isn’t. A helpful hint system keeps the difficulty from going completely off the rails.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AI—and learn a thing or two about yourself—in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.

name: Funny Ghosts! Games for kids
artistName: DOG&FROG Educational preschool kids games for girls and boys, toddlers and babies

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Classics never go out of style

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Developer Jan Ilavsky came up with the idea for this gorgeous Apple Design Award winner after he’d broken his arm. He started on an infinite runner that could be played one-handed, and since he’s also colorblind, he added a gameplay element about changing between vibrant neon colors. Chameleon Run succeeds beautifully, balancing wicked speed with irresistible, just-one-more-try challenges.
editorialNotes.short: You'll need quick reactions in this intense polychromatic platformer.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Blast enemies while rotating around a circular arena in this intense score chaser.
Are aliens really out there? Discover the truth by rummaging through crop circles, pizza trucks, and more in this interactive hidden-object game.

This spectacular collection by Zen Studios, the Jedi masters of virtual pinball, brings the Star Wars saga to life like you’ve never seen it before. Based on the films, TV shows, and even iconic characters, each dazzlingly detailed game plays like a true labor of love. Beyond the brilliant table designs, the flawless physics faithfully recreate the mechanics of real pinball with stunning sights and sounds straight out of a galaxy far, far away.

Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.
A talking goat ate your grimoire! Relearn recipes by collecting reagents and tricking folks in this bewitchingly fun fairy tale.

Our beloved Om Nom is on another quest for candy, and not even the supernatural will get in the way of his sweet tooth. Featuring a totally revamped (and gorgeous) visual style and tons of new gameplay elements, Cut the Rope: Magic totally transforms the series—as well as our hungry hero. For the first time ever, Om Nom can morph into all sorts of creatures—from a bird to a baby to a mouse—to solve each enchanting puzzle.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Revenge is a dish served with epic property damage and plenty of attitude when a princess and her pet dragon decide they’re tired of getting captured. It’s pure destructive joy guiding this royal duo over (and under) a gorgeous fantasy landscape of fleeing knights, treacherous traps, and mighty bosses to smash. The game pops with personality—and its simple controls, slick level design, and upgradable equipment keep the challenge fun and fresh.

Part platformer, part puzzler, Edge has infatuated gamers almost since the opening of the App Store. Guide a nimble cube around the narrow ledges and ever-shifting corridors of a treacherous 3D world, unlocking secrets and collecting items without falling into space. Stylishly minimalist visuals and a slick electronic soundtrack make Edge’s mix of path-finding challenges and pitfall-avoiding thrills easy to get lost in. Its dozens of levels of perfectly balanced gameplay redefine how much fun simplicity and sophistication can be.
